content.content: As I’ve read through different posts these past few months, I’ve compiled a list of acronyms to reference.  These terms seem to come up over and over again and I still don’t understand many of the details behind them.  But I thought I would share because I think it is helpful for anyone who is looking to learn and understand the discussions that go on in the community.  Please let me know if I’ve gotten anything wrong and feel free to add to the list if there are terms that could be added.  They seem to be a combination of core units, financial, crypto, and maker specific terms. https://makerdao.world/en/ and https://docs.makerdao.com/ have been very helpful.  I still struggle to understand the smart contract terms and documentation but that probably just takes time. Edit: This list is now mostly found in the Maker Operational Manual with additional links for further information.  Note there may be a few new acronyms not yet included there but the links are very helpful so check it out!  Acronyms   ALM: Asset-Liability Management  AML: Anti-Money Laundering  AMM: Automated Market Maker  CDP: Collateralized Debt Position  CES: Collateral Engineering Services Core Unit (CES-001)  COB: Collateral Onboarding  COM: Governance Communications Core Unit (COM-001)  CU: Core Unit  DAO: Decentralized Autonomous Organization  DC: Debt Ceiling  DCA: Dollar Cost Average  DC-IAM: Debt Ceiling Instant Access Module  DOI: Declaration of Intent  DSR: Dai Savings Rate  DSS: Dai Stablecoin System  DUX: Development & UX (User Experience) (DUX-001)  D3M: Direct Deposit DAI Module / DAI Direct Deposit Module  ESM: Emergency Shutdown Module  FTE: Full Time Equivalent  GSM: Governance Security Module  GDPR: General Data Protection Regulation  IPFS: InterPlanetary File System  IS: Immunefi Security Core Unit (IS-001)  KPI: Key Performance Indicators  KYC: Know Your Customer  L1/L2: Layer 1/Layer 2  MCD: Multi-Collateral Dai  MEV: Miner Extracted Value  MIP: Maker Improvement Proposal  MKR: The ERC-20 token used for governance in MakerDAO  NFT: Non-Fungible Tokens  OMC: Open Markets Committee  LP: Liquidity Provider / Liquidation Penalty  LR: Liquidation Ratio  MIP: Maker Improvement Proposal  OKR: Objectives and Key Results  OSM: Oracle Security Module  PE/PECU: Protocol Engineering Core Unit (PE-001)  PMF: Product Market Fit  PSM: Peg Stability Module  RoA: Return over Asset  RoE: Return over Equity  RP: Risk Premium  RFC: Request For Comment  RWA: Real-World Assets  RWF: Real-World Finance Core Unit (RWF-001)  SCD/SAI: Single Collateral DAI  SES: Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling Core Unit (SES-001)  SB: Surplus Buffer / System Surplus Buffer  SC: Smart Contracts  SF: Stability Fee  SP: Subproposal  SPV: Special Purpose Vehicle  SR: Signal Request  SS: System Surplus  TAM: Total Addressable Market  TDC: Target Debt Ceiling  TFE: Tax Favorable Entity  TLM: Term Lending Module  TPAM: Target Price Adjustment Module  TRFM: Target Rate Feedback Mechanism  TVL: Total Value Locked  TWAP: Time-Weighted Average Price   Collateral   Non-stablecoins   Curve:  Curve Finance, AMM Platform  G-UNI: Automated LP for Uniswap v3 powered by Gelato  LINK: ChainLink Token  MANA: Decentraland Token  MATIC: Polygon Token  PETH: Pooled Ether  renBTC: ERC20-Token pegged to Bitcoin, backed on RenVM Protocol  stEth: Lido Staked Ether  UNI: Uniswap  WBTC: Wrapped Bitcoin  YFI: Yearn.finance Token   Real World Assets   CF-DROP: ConsolFreight DROP (Freight Forwarding Invoices)  DROP: Centrifuge Senior Tranche Token  FFT1-DROP: Fortunafi DROP (Revenue Based Financing Assets)  HTC-DROP: Harbor Trade Credit DROP (Short Term Trade Receivables)  NS-DROP: New Silver DROP (US-based Residential Real Estate)  RWA-001/SIXS: 6S Capital SPV (Real-Estate and Renewable Energy/Sustainability)  TIN: Centrifuge Junior Tranche Token   Stablecoins   GUSD: Gemini Dollar  USDP: Pax Dollar (Paxos)  USDC: USD Coin (Circle)
Thanks for posting this information, it can be very useful for newbies.
This should be fixed, it is more than important terminology for the protocol. @LongForWisdom @prose11 @juan @Sebix

@Traster_Tray this is a nice, comprehensive list of Maker-related acronyms. This is something we (GovAlpha) could add to the Maker Operational Manual if you and others would find it useful. If you’re happy - I can add it for you. Or, if you’d like to collaborate, hit up me or @Gala and we can direct you to the Github repo to contribute to the project.
Thank you! this is @Traster_Tray this is super useful

I kind of made this off the cuff so it feels strange to do so but if people are ok with it, I don’t mind adding it.  Since it has gotten a good response, I’ll keep it updated as I stumble upon things but again, feel free to critique/add/edit.  I’m definitely not qualified to be the arbiter of all maker related terms.
Don’t worry, we wouldn’t ask you to be solely responsible. I’ll DM you the details

Patrick_J:  This is something we (GovAlpha) could add to the Maker Operational Manual  if you and others would find it useful.   I find it useful! I’m sure many others will appreciate a Maker Manual Glossary.
Hey, this is a great start. Thank you for doing this because as I was reading it I noticed I was misinterpreting some letters
MightyOx:  Maker Manual Glossary.   YES! Very helpful for onboarding!

Oh damn, how much I suffered with these abbreviations before… I thought I just couldn’t find a summary of them in the Manual, but apparently they didn’t exist in that form.  I always had to hunt them up from somewhere. Since this topic has come up, it would be useful to take this idea further. It would be useful if it could be incorporated into this forum somehow.   The simplest solution is a pinned post where it can be quickly searched for.   It should be investigated whether it is technically feasible to insert active abbreviations into the text, which when the cursor is over them will bring up the name of the abbreviation.   This would speed up the learning process.

purrfection:  It should be investigated whether it is technically feasible to insert active abbreviations into the text, which when the cursor is over them will bring up the name of the abbreviation.   We will look into whether this is possible.
This is great! A couple you could add are KYC (know your consumer) and AML (anti money laundering) bc those show up a lot in some older posts I’ve seen
Not exactly acronyms but added Collateral that has been integrated!  I find having the list of real world assets to be especially helpful.
As a new member and newbie contributor, I appreciate your work. I know I will make use of this list often. Thank you for sharing!

I came across this recently. Another 50+ useful abbreviation.   twitter.com    Misha @MishadaVinci  Web3 lingo is confusing.  This list of 50+ terms will get you up to speed (fast):   12:46 PM - 17 Apr 2022           11K                2.6K            Learn and understand the meaning of BTFD and BUIDL are very useful nowadays.
This is now live on the governance manual here. Thanks @Traster_Tray for taking the time to get this started.
Very useful thread, actually these terms are used in the crypto community.
Hi, i’ve notice in some posts they talk about PMF, I don’t see that therm in here, could someone tell me what it means and how it works?
Product market fit. The match between a good/service and demand.
This is great. @Traster_Tray did you add this to a documentation portal somewhere to be further enhanced?

@Patrick_J helped get it added to the governance docs and they’ve linked some of the acronyms to the appropriate documentation.  I’ll edit the opening post to provide this link.  But I’ll also keep editing this post as I or others see missing acronyms and maybe push changes over to GovAlpha every once in awhile.
Thanks for that. I love this thread/post !
Thankyou @Traster_Tray for the list this is really very useful and Thanks @Patrick_J for adding it on the governance manual here
Nice. Thanks
This is very useful. Thanks @Traster_Tray
